entry.string: Julian
What is it?
Julian is the Basic Calendar for Xaraya.
It is currently responsible for accomplishing these tasks:
entry.translation: Het is momenteel mogelijk om de volgende taken uit te voeren:

entry.string: Display a calendar for day, week, month or year.
entry.translation: Toon een kalender voor dag, week, maand of jaar.

entry.string: Display events for a given date.
entry.translation: Toon gebeurtenissen op een bepaalde datum.

entry.string: Send out an alert with the upcoming events
How to use it?
Use it like a calendar.
Julian has some requirements at this moment.
entry.translation: Julian heeft op dit moment enkele benodigdheden.

entry.string: The dependancies should have been resolved at installation, otherwise you are not seeing this page.
entry.translation: De afhankelijkheden zouden nu opgelost moeten zijn, anders zou u deze pagina niet te zien krijgen.

entry.string: Included Blocks
Month Calendar. This block shows a graphical representation of the current month.
Today's Events and Upcoming Events. This block shows a short list of the events of today and for the upcoming X days. You can set the amount of days in the future you want the block to show.
Security
Julian has a full set of security levels. The checks are carried out on:
entry.translation: Julian beschikt over een complete set van beveilligingsregels. De regels gebruiken:

entry.string: Event ID.
Calendar ID (not in use at present).
Category ID. This check works together with the category privileges. You will need to give users read or edit level access to the Julian categories as well.
Owner or Organizer ID. This is the user that has entered the event. In future we will implement the use of 'MYSELF' as a check.
Included Hooks
Julian offers a hook that will enable you to hook any content type to the calendar.
The hook shows an input form with all the information needed. You can attach this hook to your own publication type for instance.
In your pubtype, you can then add the data needed by Julian to show the event in the calendar.
The hook has been tested with various modules like articles and example. It will work with any module that provides a clear userapi-getitemlinks function.
Known Bugs
Program can't view dates in the year 2038 or beyond on 32bit *nix machines.
entry.translation: Programma kan geen data bekijken in het jaar 2038 of hoger op 32bit *nix machines.

entry.string: The alert subscriptions cannot be migrated from earlier version to 0.2.1. Users need to subscribe again.
entry.translation: De waarschuwings berichten kunnen niet gemigreerd worden vanaf een versie vroeger dan 0.2.1. Gebruikers moeten zich opnieuw inschrijven.

entry.string: Further information on the Julian module can be found at
entry.translation: Meer informatie over de Julian module kan worden gevonden op

Julian Module - Xaraya Extension 319
Click on Version History tab at the bottom to get the latest release information.
Related documentation on Julian can be found at
